title: Nvidia's Recent Developments and Market Performance
body:
**Financial Performance:**

Nvidia reported record-breaking earnings for the third quarter of fiscal 2026, with revenue reaching $57.0 billion, a 62% increase from the previous year. Net income rose 65% to $31.9 billion. This growth was primarily driven by overwhelming demand for its advanced Blackwell AI chips, with data center revenue alone accounting for $51.2 billion, up 66% year-over-year. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Announces-Financial-Results-for-Third-Quarter-Fiscal-2026/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

**Market Reaction:**

Following the earnings announcement, Nvidia's stock experienced significant volatility. Despite the strong financial results, the stock price declined from approximately $195 to $180, reducing the company's market capitalization by about $365 billion. CEO Jensen Huang expressed frustration over this market reaction, suggesting that Nvidia's success may have fueled concerns about a potential AI investment bubble. ([tomshardware.com](https://www.tomshardware.com/tech-industry/nvidia-ceo-jensen-huang-complains-about-stock-price-slide-during-all-hands-meeting-says-market-did-not-appreciate-companys-incredible-quarter?utm_source=openai))

**Regulatory Developments:**

In a recent development, former U.S. President Donald Trump indicated that Nvidia might be allowed to resume sales of its H200 AI chips to China, which were previously restricted due to U.S. export controls. This potential concession could open up a significant market for Nvidia, with analysts projecting potential revenues of $15–25 billion from renewed access. However, uncertainties remain regarding Chinese demand and regulatory approvals. ([moneyweek.com](https://moneyweek.com/investments/nvidia-share-price?utm_source=openai))

**Stock Performance:**

As of December 19, 2025, Nvidia's stock (NVDA) is trading at $180.99, reflecting a 3.85% increase from the previous close. The stock has experienced significant volatility following recent earnings reports and regulatory developments.

key_dates.title: Q3 Fiscal 2026 Earnings Report
key_dates.importance_for_price: Nvidia reported record revenue and net income, driven by high demand for AI chips, leading to initial stock price volatility.

key_dates.title: Potential Resumption of H200 Chip Sales to China
key_dates.importance_for_price: Former President Trump's indication of lifting export restrictions could open significant markets for Nvidia, potentially boosting stock value.

key_points.text: Nvidia's Q3 fiscal 2026 revenue reached $57.0 billion, a 62% year-over-year increase.
Despite strong earnings, Nvidia's stock experienced volatility, with a notable decline post-earnings announcement.
Potential resumption of H200 AI chip sales to China could significantly impact Nvidia's future revenue.
